PP1ST MAY, 1953CABINET' PROVISION FOR OLD AGSMemorandum by the Chancellor of the exchequer at their meeting on 27th February (H.A.(53) 5th Meeting, Item 2), theHome Affairs Committee agreed, subject to Cabinet approval, that the financialand economic problems arising from the provision made for old age ought tobe investigated by an independent and authoritative Committee of Enquiry.2. I invite my colleagues to endorse this recommendation. I suggestthat the terms of reference for the Committee should be as follows:-"To review the economic and financial problems involved in providing for old age,having regard to the prospective increase inthe number of the aged, and to make recommendations. "3. The Lord Privy Seal, the Minister of Labour, the Minister of national insurance and I are considering possible names for the Chairman and themembers of this Committee.R.A.B.Treasury Chambers, S.W.1.1ST MAY, 1953.
